item.title: 中国发出旅游警告后日本旅游股下跌，研究报告
item.description: 周一，日本旅游业和与旅游相关的股票大跌，此前中国政府警告其公民不要前往日本旅游和留学，两国之间的外交争执不断加深。【原文：Japanese tourism and travel-related stocks slumped Monday after Beijing warned its citizens against traveling to and studying in Japan amid a deepening diplomatic spat between the nations.】

item.title: 英国预算案公布前数百万英镑房屋销售额大幅下降
item.description: 最新数据显示，10 月份英国最昂贵住宅的销售量大幅下滑，富裕买家似乎对工党即将发布的预算案中所谓的豪宅税前景望而却步。【原文：Sales of the UK’s most expensive homes plummeted in October, according to new data, with affluent buyers appearing to be put off by the prospect of a so-called mansion tax in Labour’s upcoming budget.】

item.title: 日本国内生产总值（GDP）缩水，支持田中一郎的财政刺激主张
item.description: 日本经济六个季度以来首次出现萎缩，为首相高市真奈提出的雄心勃勃的经济刺激计划提供了支持。【原文：Japan’s economy contracted for the first time in six quarters, supporting Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s case to compile an ambitious economic stimulus package.】

item.title: 新西兰人口增长缓慢阻碍经济复苏
item.description: 除大流行病外，新西兰的人口增长速度是近 13 年来最慢的，这进一步阻碍了新西兰疲软的经济复苏。【原文：New Zealand’s population is growing at the slowest pace in nearly 13 years, excluding the pandemic, further hampering its sluggish economic recovery.】

item.title: 俄罗斯新罗西斯克港恢复运营，石油价格下跌
item.description: 有迹象表明，俄罗斯黑海重要港口新罗西斯克的活动已经恢复，在此之前，乌克兰上周的罢工造成了一些损失并暂停了运营，石油随之下跌。【原文：Oil dropped following signs that activity had resumed at the key Russian port of Novorossiysk on the Black Sea, after a Ukrainian strike last week led to some damage and a suspension of operations.】

item.title: 降息押注减少，黄金连跌两日后回升
item.description: 受美国联邦储备委员会（US Federal Reserve）下月降息的乐观情绪减弱的刺激，黄金走高，止住了连续两天的跌势。【原文：Gold edged higher, halting two days of losses spurred by fading optimism the US Federal Reserve will cut interest rates next month.】

item.title: 香港学生宿舍吸引私募股权投资，投资额达 4.12 亿美元
item.description: 这就是私募股权巨头在房地产峰会上大肆宣扬的东西，也是代理商向客户推销的东西；不是购物中心，不是数据中心，而是学生宿舍。【原文：It’s what private equity giants tout at property summits and agents pitch to clients — not shopping malls, not data centers, but student dormitories.】

item.title: EQT 亿万富翁大举进军亚洲，向华尔街巨头发起挑战
item.description: 亿万富翁投资人让-埃里克-萨拉塔（Jean Eric Salata）首次进军亚洲的经历十分痛苦：在印度五次注销，损失不断增加，价值数亿美元。由于日子过得太艰难，他把自己的电脑密码改成了 "坚持不懈"，每天提醒自己要坚持下去。【原文：Billionaire investor Jean Eric Salata’s first foray into Asia was painful: Five write-offs in India and mounting losses worth hundreds of millions of dollars. Times were so tough, he changed his computer password to “perseverance” as a daily reminder to keep going.】

item.title: 智利共产党人和保守派在通往总统决选的路上
item.description: 智利共产主义者珍妮特-哈拉（Jeannette Jara）和保守派人士何塞-安东尼奥-卡斯特（José Antonio Kast）似乎将在下个月的总统竞选中决出胜负。【原文：Chilean communist Jeannette Jara and arch-conservative José Antonio Kast appear to be headed to next month’s presidential runoff that will spotlight starkly divergent views on how to lead one of Latin America’s richest economies.】

item.title: 数据延迟发布，亚洲开盘后走势低迷：市场综述
item.description: 在美联储政策路径的不确定性挥之不去的情况下，投资者为一系列美国经济数据做好了准备，亚洲市场的开局显得谨慎。比特币抹去了今年的涨幅。【原文：Asian markets look set for a cautious start as investors brace for a barrage of US economic data amid lingering uncertainty over the Federal Reserve’s policy path. Bitcoin erased its gains for the year.】

item.title: 美国人的退休储蓄在海外打造华尔街帝国
item.description:
阿波罗公司被广泛复制的玩法是将数十亿资金输送给百慕大群岛的关联公司，从而失去美国担保

。【原文：

Apollo’s widely copied playbook is funneling billions to Bermuda affiliates, losing US guarantees

】

item.title: 华平投资的普林斯顿进军韩国，建立首个数据中心
item.description: 由美国华平投资集团（Warburg Pincus）支持的亚洲数据中心运营商普林斯顿数字集团（Princeton Digital Group）计划投资 7 亿美元建设其在韩国的首个园区，以推动该国的人工智能发展。【原文：Princeton Digital Group, a data center operator in Asia backed by Warburg Pincus, plans to invest $700 million in its first South Korean campus to power artificial intelligence development in the country.】

item.title: 美国制裁推动中国人工智能神童创造 230 亿美元财富
item.description: 2019 年，陈天石距离成为这个星球上最富有的人之一还有很长的路要走。【原文：In 2019, Chen Tianshi was a long way from becoming one of the wealthiest people on the planet.】

item.title: Starz 有意收购 A+E，合并小型电视网
item.description: 谁想买下一批衰落的电视网？【原文：Who wants to buy a bunch of declining TV networks?】

item.title: 债券交易员关注决定美联储下一步行动的关键数据
item.description: 债券交易员们正在为大量数据做好准备，这些数据将巩固人们对美联储继续降息的速度的预期，这些数据推动美国国债创下了 2020 年以来的最大涨幅。【原文：Bond traders are bracing for a deluge of data that will solidify expectations for how quickly the Federal Reserve will continue the interest-rate cuts that have driven US Treasuries to the biggest gains since 2020.】

item.title: 据说大昌华嘉将竞购瑞士药品分销商 Swixx 生物制药公司
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，总部位于苏黎世的药品分销公司大昌华嘉控股公司（DKSH Holding AG）是竞购瑞士药品分销公司 Swixx Biopharma SA 的竞购者之一。【原文：DKSH Holding AG, the Zurich-based distribution firm, is among bidders vying to acquire Swiss drug distribution company Swixx Biopharma SA, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 卡尼为通过预算案和避免临时大选寻找选票
item.description: 加拿大总理马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）的政府周一将面临一个决定性的时刻，加拿大下议院将就增加借贷以用于军事和基础设施建设的预算提案进行投票。【原文：Prime Minister Mark Carney’s government faces a decisive moment on Monday when Canada’s House of Commons votes on a proposed budget that would increase borrowing to spend on the military and infrastructure.】

item.title: ASML 首席执行官称，Nexperia 冲突表明对话是芯片行业的关键
item.description: 荷兰科技巨头ASML控股公司（ASML Holding NV）负责人周日表示，最近荷兰与中国就芯片制造商Nexperia的对峙引发的危机凸显了供应链是多么脆弱，以及为什么对话对于防止争端升级至关重要。【原文：The crisis sparked by the recent standoff between the Netherlands and China over chipmaker Nexperia underscores just how fragile the supply chain is and why dialog is vital to prevent disputes from spiraling, the head of Dutch technology giant ASML Holding NV said on Sunday.】

item.title: 贝森特称特朗普的 2000 美元支票需要国会投票通过
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）表示，唐纳德-特朗普总统提出的向美国公民发送 2000 美元关税 "红利 "的建议需要国会批准。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said President Donald Trump’s proposal to send $2,000 “dividend” payments from tariffs to US citizens would require congressional approval.】

item.title: 德国财政部长访华前力促公平贸易
item.description: 德国财政部长拉尔斯-克林拜尔（Lars Klingbeil）在启程前往亚洲进行高风险访问时，呼吁建立一个 "开放的、基于规则的全球贸易体系"，因为美国、中国和欧洲之间的贸易限制摩擦正在加剧。【原文：German Finance Minister Lars Klingbeil pressed for an “open, rules-based global trading system” as he departed for a high-stakes visit to Asia, as frictions over trade restrictions between the US, China and Europe ramp up.】

item.title: 塞尔维亚总统称，塞尔维亚可能 "高价 "从新独立国家联合体手中收购俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司
item.description: 塞尔维亚总统亚历山大-武契奇（Aleksandar Vucic）周日表示，塞尔维亚愿意为重新获得炼油厂 NIS AD 的控制权支付一定的溢价，因为塞尔维亚正在想方设法使这家俄罗斯所有的公司摆脱美国的严厉制裁。【原文：Serbia is willing to pay a premium to regain control of oil refiner NIS AD as it seeks ways to unshackle the Russian-owned company from crippling US sanctions, President Aleksandar Vucic said on Sunday.】

item.title: 流行的零日期权策略抑制股票反弹
item.description: 投资者每天的期权抛售浪潮有望减缓股票持续反弹的速度，使其重回历史高位。【原文：Investors’ daily waves of option sales are poised to slow a sustained stock rally back to record highs.】

item.title: 希腊将从 12 月起向乌克兰供应美国天然气
item.description: 乌克兰表示已与希腊达成协议，这将有助于确保即将到来的冬季供暖季的天然气供应。【原文：Ukraine said it’s reached an agreement with Greece that will help secure the supply of natural gas for the coming winter heating season.】

item.title: 苹果公司对 iPhone 的全面改革将减少对年度秋季盛会的依赖
item.description: 苹果公司的 iPhone 将迎来迄今为止最大的变革，包括功能和发布时间。以下是该公司旗舰产品的最新动态。还有：Mac Pro 已退居二线，特斯拉也终于加入了对 CarPlay 的支持。最后，苹果公司的长期运营主管结束了他在公司的工作。【原文：Apple’s iPhone is getting its biggest makeover yet — both to its features and release schedule. Here’s what’s happening to the company’s flagship product. Also: The Mac Pro is on the back burner, and Tesla is finally adding support for CarPlay. Lastly, Apple’s longtime operating chief wraps up his time at the company.】

item.title: 新兴市场交易拥挤引来基金经理警告
item.description: 今年最受欢迎的一些新兴市场交易，如押注巴西雷亚尔和与人工智能相关的股票，正成为资金经理们担忧的根源，他们警告过度拥挤带来的风险。【原文：Some of the year’s most popular emerging-market trades such as betting on the Brazilian real and stocks linked to artificial intelligence are becoming a source of concern as money managers warn of risks from overcrowding.】

item.title: 加沙停火前以色列经济强劲反弹
item.description: 以色列的经济在第三季度明显加速，从 6 月与伊朗的 12 天战争引发的暴跌中恢复过来，并先于 10 月中旬达成的加沙停火。【原文：Israel’s economy significantly accelerated in the third quarter, recovering from a plunge triggered by the 12-day war with Iran in June and ahead of the ceasefire in Gaza reached in mid-October.】

item.title: 智利举行大选，右翼势力有望赢得总统宝座
item.description: 智利人将于周日前往投票站选举总统，因为这个拉丁美洲最富裕的国家之一正面临着犯罪率居高不下、非法移民和经济疲软等陌生的挑战。【原文：Chileans are heading to the polls on Sunday to elect a president as one of Latin America’s wealthiest nations faces the unfamiliar challenges of high crime, clandestine migration and a torpid economy.】

item.title: 南非推进核电扩建计划
item.description: 南非电力部长拉马克戈帕（Kgosientsho Ramakgopa）周日表示，南非将推进建造一座新核电站的计划，并恢复其模块化核反应堆项目，这是为确保长期能源稳定而开展的更广泛工作的一部分。【原文：South Africa will move forward with plans to build a new nuclear plant and revive its modular nuclear reactor program, part of a broader push to secure long-term energy stability, Electricity Minister Kgosientsho Ramakgopa said on Sunday.】

item.title: 韩国企业集团承诺在国内投资 4640 亿美元
item.description: 三星电子公司、现代汽车集团和 LG 集团在与韩国总统李在明会面后承诺，将在未来五年内在韩国投资总计 4,640 亿美元。【原文：Samsung Electronics Co., Hyundai Motor Group and LG Group pledged to invest a combined $464 billion in South Korea over the next five years after meeting with President Lee Jae Myung, who is seeking to shore up the economy following the country’s trade deal with the US.】

item.title: 造币厂称印度 Hygenco 公司可能以 1.25 亿美元的价格出售 49% 的股份
item.description: 据《造币厂报》援引未具名人士的话报道，Hygenco Green Energies Pvt 公司可能以 1.25 亿美元的价格向包括世界银行国际金融公司在内的一个财团出售 49% 的股份，从而帮助这家印度公司实现其在本十年末发展 10 千兆瓦绿色氢生产能力的目标。【原文：Hygenco Green Energies Pvt may sell a 49% stake to a consortium including the World Bank’s International Finance Corp. for $125 million, helping the Indian company to realize its goal to develop 10 gigawatts of green hydrogen production capacity by the end of the decade, Mint newspaper reported, citing unidentified people.】
